page.title: 13Coast - Shipping
page.content: East Wemyss and Buckhaven are situated at the mouth of the River Forth which is a busy shipping channel for both commercial and naval vessels. Tankers can always be seen in the Firth of Forth either coming or going from the oil terminals at Braefoot Bay (Dalgety Bay) and Hound Point (Forth Bridge). Empty tankers are often seen anchored quite close to the shore, especially in bad weather. In addition to the tankers there are often Royal Navy boats seen on manouvers in the Firth. The Navy boats come from the Royal Navy Base at Rosyth, further up the river past the Forth Bridges.
